post.author: thomas lee
post.content:
I had watched two movies over the weekend. Both of them were excellent. I strongly recommend.
"About Schmidt" staring Jack Nicholson personal soul searching story by a retired insurance company executive. Simple story with profound meaning of life.
"The Pianist" directed by Roman Polanski World War II Holocaust story of a pianist. Deep humanism
About Roman Polanski : born in Paris but originally Polish every one of them is entertaining and educational about what is happening in the world.
List of Movies by Roman Polanski ================================ Knife in the Water (1962) Les plus belles escroqueries du monde (1964, with Claude Chabrol, Jean-Luc Godard and Hiromichi Horikawa) Repulsion (1965) Cul-de-Sac (1966) The Fearless Vampire Killers (1967) [2.] Rosemary's Baby (1968) Macbeth (1971) What? (1973) Chinatown (1974) The Tenant (1976) Tess (1979) Pirates (1986) Frantic (1988) Bitter Moon (1992) Death and the Maiden (1994) The Ninth Gate (1999) The Pianist (2001)
Speaking of Director there is another director I like tremendously "Oliver Stone" He can tell you the story of what actually happens underneath in USA. Vietnam war, JFK, and etc.
List of his movies ================== The Hand Platoon Salvador Wall Street Talk Radio Born on the Fourth of July JFK The Doors Heaven and Earth Natural Born Killers Nixon U-Turn Any Given Sunday
If you did not have the chance to enjoy some of above movies, be my guests. You would not be disappointed
